intro: Polygonum erythrocladum, commonly known as red-stem smartweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It is characterized by its reddish stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, appearing in late summer. It thrives in moist to wet soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Polygonum erythrocladum is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like buckwheat and sorrel.
